wikipedia_page.main: Samuel Noble (1779–1853) was an English engraver, and minister of the New Church (Swedenborgian).

response: * Samuel Noble, English engraver, and minister of the New Church
Tulk contributed for some years to the Intellectual Repository, started in 1812 under the editorship of Samuel Noble. His separate publications were:
George Noble (fl. 1795–1806) was an English line-engraver. The son of Edward Noble, author of Elements of Linear Perspective, he was brother to Samuel Noble and William Bonneau Noble.

Reading the Appeal by Samuel Noble led Child to accept the doctrines of Emanuel Swedenborg. As a preacher of the New Church, he officiated at Newcastle-on-Tyne (1872), moving to Lowestoft (1874) and to Bath, Somerset (1876), where he was ordained on 15 October 1878.
*Anti-Swedenborg (1824); replied to by Thomas Goyder, as "Gulielmas", and then Samuel Noble, for the New Jerusalem Church.
